content.description: This is a fun route for a sport climber who wants to try placing some cams. From the base of fun offwidth, walk to the right and scramble to the first bolt. Alternatively, you could climb the first 20 ft of fun offwidth until you find the first bolt up and to the right of a double crack system.From there, do some easy, bolted slab moves on the face just to the right of fun offwidth. Belay from a 2 bolt anchor 10 ft right of the fun offwidth pitch 2 belay horn. From the belay, you could try fun offwidth, or continue up the bolt line to a right leaning fist crack (we thought about continuing up the crack and walking off the backside, weren't sure about the top belay). Place a couple cams, then exit the crack to the the left, clip a few bolts, and end at the chains also used for fun offwidth.Rap all the way to the ground with a 70 m rope. Pitch 2 is a fun route to bail on if you aren't feeling the second pitch of fun offwidth.
content.protection: Mostly bolts w/ some medium cams   P1 can be done all on bolts to a bolted anchor w/ no rings. Optional to start on fun offwidth by slinging chockstones and/or pluging a #3   P2 - 2 bolts to medium cams in right leaning crack to bolts, then chain anchors
content.location: Central face of me and ewe. Start up and to the right of fun offwidth or start on fun offwidth. Look for a bolt to the right of a double crack system on fun offwidth. Can start on fun offwidth, or scramble up around to the right about 20 ft up. Shares rap station with fun offwidth.

climbs.name: Muck-boots and Ewe
climbs.fa: November 2018, Tom and Bridget Dancs, Laura and Gabe Webster, Bruce Ross, Victoria Cussen (a.k.a. Poo Crew)

content.protection: 10 bolts, shares chain anchor with Ewe and Me and Ewe Can Do IT.
content.location: Obvious bolted line up center of crag.

climbs.name: Me and Ewe
climbs.fa: November 2018, Tom and Bridget Dancs, Laura and Gabe Webster, Bruce Ross, Victoria Cussen (a.k.a Poo Crew)

content.description: Start up slab, climb widening crack to top. Look for great hourglass to sling for protection left of crack.
content.protection: Gear to 4 inches. Two bolt anchor with chains. Please use your own gear to top rope.

content.description: Follows the offwidth system up the central face. It's very fun! Climb into the chimney up top and stick towards the back. There's a bomber ​#11 hex placement in there on the left if you've got one clanking around. Finish on the chains up right at the top. One 70m rap or walk off. AJ and I saw this line on the night of the super moon and followed it to glory.
content.protection: Gear to #6 camalot, we used 2 #4's (one for the belay).   Bring a big purple hex because it's awesome.
content.location: ​Central face of Me and Ewe, there's a 2 pitch bolted line to the right that finishes on the same chains. I've only tr solo'd that route but it seems very well protected mostly 5.6 with some good hand jams and stiffer (5.8?) moves up high.

climbs.name: Ewe Can Do It
climbs.fa: November 2018, Tom and Bridget Dancs, Laura and Gabe Webster, Bruce Ross, Victoria Cussen (a.k.a. Poo Crew)

content.description: Small/Medium cam to protect start. Then face climb past 4 bolts to join the upper part of Me and Ewe.
content.protection: 4 bolts, gear to 4 inches. Shares chain anchor with Ewe and Me.
content.location: Next route to the right of Me and Ewe.

climbs.name: Ewe Are Awesome!
climbs.fa: November 2018, Tom and Bridget Dancs, Laura and Gabe Webster, Bruce Ross, Victoria Cussen (a.k.a. Poo Crew)

content.description: Bolted face to easy crack, exit crack onto face at last bolt just before the anchor. Easy and fun.
content.protection: 4 Bolts, gear to 3 inches. Chain anchors.

content.description: Shade, Short Approach, Trad, Sport, Moderate Routes.
